content.description: Stand start with a left credit card crimp and a right hand on either a sloper ball or another thin crimp. Delicately move up to the large crimp in the seam. Once standing in the seam, you'll have a fun time trying to find footholds that allow you to reach the lip of the boulder, which is a jug. Breath and topout. This line is taller than Bonesaw Timebomb and just as thin, but the crimp rail makes it less sustained..
content.protection: Two pads is more than enough.
content.location: This line goes straight up the left side of the Mother of All Slabs. Just left of the dead stump. Pink line on the topo.

climbs.name: The Mother of All Slabs (It Comes and It Goes)

content.description: Stand start directly under the point of the triangular boulder with a partially hollow flake and crimps. Delicately crimp your way up to a three finger pocket and a hollow flake at 22 feet. Realize there are not more footholds and crank on micro crimps to reach the lip and topout. Rehearsing on toprope is advised.
content.protection: Stack at least three pads and embrace the cheese grater.
content.location: This line goes straight up the most proud tall slab smack in the middle of the Tilted Tree Area's entrance.

content.description: Stand start with a right foot smear, a left hand two finger credit card pocket, and whatever small edge right hand you can manage. Climb straight up credit card crimps and tiny crystal divots until you reach a left hand sloper sidepull just below the lip. Carefully reach for the lip and enjoy an easy gritty topout.
content.protection: A single pad will do, but the top move is very puntable.
content.location: The is the left most line on the West face of the Mother of All Slabs boulder. (Yellow)
